paragraph.paragraph: EiffelEnvision projects are like most Visual Studio .NET language-base projects, such as Visual C#, Visual Basic .NET and Visual J#, but with a flair of Eiffel. Just like those aforementioned languages, EiffelEnvision projects, predominately, ms-help//MS.VSCC.2003/MS.MSDNQTR.2003FEB.1033/vsintro7/html/vxconFolder-BasedReference-BasedProjects.htm manage files , and directly reflect and underlying file system. However, there are fundamental differences between EiffelEnvision projects and other language projects, even those that ms-help//MS.VSCC.2003/MS.MSDNQTR.2003FEB.1033/vsintro7/html/vxconFolder-BasedReference-BasedProjects.htm manage files .

EiffelEnvision projects, denoted by the ../../../images/icons/project.ico icon in the ms-help//MS.VSCC.2003/MS.MSDNQTR.2003FEB.1033/vsintro7/html/vxurfSolutionExplorerDialog.htm Solution Explorer , are segregated into four very distinct segments, sectioned beneath the EiffelEnvision project node.
../../../images/icons/references.ico
project.xml references References
../../../images/icons/project_items.ico
project.xml project_items Project Items
../../../images/icons/eiffel_libraries.ico
project.xml eiffel_libraries Eiffel Libraries
../../../images/icons/folder.ico
project.xml other_project_items Other Project Items
Each section is disparate from each other. Only the project.xml project_items Project Items and project.xml eiffel_libraries Eiffel Libraries nodes base any resemblance to one another.

The References of an EiffelEnvision project contains all of the project's component references, added to a project when a project is created using one of the
../adding_projects/projects.xml EiffelEnvision Project Templates or when explicitly ms-help//MS.VSCC.2003/MS.MSDNQTR.2003FEB.1033/vsintro7/html/vxtskAddingRemovingProjectReferences.htm Adding References . For more information about the References section of an EiffelEnvision project, see references/references_folder.xml References Folder .

Project Items is a logical section of an ../index.xml EiffelEnvision Project to group all project specific project files and folders. To promote and maintain a project.xml clean_separation Clean Separation between project files and other source libraries, only those files store under the project's location should be included here. For more information on Project Items, see project_items/index.xml Project Items .

The Eiffel Libraries folder is specifically use to reference any Eiffel source libraries you want to reuse from an ../index.xml EiffelEnvision Project . For more information on this folder, see eiffel_libraries/index.xml Eiffel Libraries

It may be necessary to reference files that reside outside of any ../index.xml EiffelEnvision Project and with the Other Project Items folder this is possible. Unlike any of the folders under the Project Items or Eiffel Libraries folders, Other Project Items folder and file items do not have to map directly to a location on disk, instead a virtual hierarchy of folder and file item reference can be created. For more information see other_project_items/index.xml Other Project Items .

Eiffel's principle system of reuse is through source code reuse, unlike the .NET Framework's binary reuse through assemblies. ../../../eiffel_for_dotnet/index.xml Eiffel for .NET still maintains reuse through source code, as Eiffel does, but also permits binary reuse through assemblies and ../configuring/adding_references/precompiled_libraries.xml Precompiled Libraries . EiffelEnvision supports all of these concepts, but unlike other environments, used in conjunction with Eiffel or Eiffel for .NET, there is no implicit, clean separation is made between project files/source code and reused Eiffel libraries source code. In ../../../eiffel_for_dotnet/index.xml Eiffel for .NET further separation is required between source code reuse and binary reuse, using assemblies.

EiffelEnvision remedies this integral issue with a very distinct and clean separation between component (assembly) references, project files, where it be a bitmap resource or Eiffel ../../../../../technologies/dotnet/eiffel_dotnet_language/index.xml class source file, and Eiffel source libraries. As aforementioned, EiffelEnvision includes a project.xml references References section for each of it's projects. Contained within this section are all component and ../configuring/adding_references/precompiled_libraries.xml Precompiled Library references for that project. project_items/project_items.xml Project Items and eiffel_libraries/eiffel_libraries.xml Eiffel Libraries support the separation of project-specific Eiffel ../../../../../technologies/dotnet/eiffel_dotnet_language/10_conventions/10_terminology.xml classes and files and Eiffel library ../../../../../technologies/dotnet/eiffel_dotnet_language/10_conventions/10_terminology.xml class source files, respectively. Although the separation between project_items/project_items.xml Project Items and
eiffel_libraries/eiffel_libraries.xml Eiffel Libraries is not strictly enforce by EiffelEnvision, for other tool compatibility reasons, it is recommended that all EiffelEnvision projects adhere to this convention. Clean separation will assist in the future maintenance or adoption of your projects, by other developers. Because Eiffel source files are include using ../../../../../technologies/dotnet/eiffel_dotnet_language/10_conventions/10_terminology.xml clusters , there will be no confusion as to what files are project files and what files are Eiffel library sources.
